oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Prevalence and characteristics of radiographically confirmed juvenile tarsal osteochondrosis in purebred Angus bulls
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Emerson, S. E.
Barrett, M. F.
Holt, T. N.
Bass, L.
Rao, S.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: lameness
breeding bulls
osteochondrosis
lesions
characteristics
sire association
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hindlimb lameness in breeding bulls is a source of significant financial loss, with a proportion of bulls having osteochondrosis (OC). The objective of this study is to determine the characteristics, change over time, and sire association of radiographically identified tarsal OC lesions in a purebred Angus breeding herd.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2016; 190-191
